bibl.title: Local Potentes in the Roman Empire: A New Approach to the Concept of Local Elites.
bibl.note: See in part. pp. 430-431: the cases of Valerius Titanianus, landowner in Philadelphia in the late second century, and of Calpurnia Heraclia alias Eudamia, landowner in the Oxyrhynchite nome in the middle years of the third century.
bibl.seg: SLOOTJES Daniëlle, Local Potentes in the Roman Empire: A New Approach to the Concept of Local Elites.

See in part. pp. 430-431: the cases of Valerius Titanianus, landowner in Philadelphia in the late second century, and of Calpurnia Heraclia alias Eudamia, landowner in the Oxyrhynchite nome in the middle years of the third century.
